relation: configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
router eigrp autonomous-system Example: Device(config)# router eigrp 101
eigrp event-log-size size Example: Device(config-router)# eigrp event-log-size 5000010
eigrp log-neighbor-changes Example: Device(config-router)# eigrp log-neighbor-changes
eigrp log-neighbor-warnings [seconds] Example: Device(config-router)# eigrp log-neighbor-warnings 300
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enables an EIGRP routing process and enters router configuration mode. A maximum of 30 EIGRP routing processes can be configured.
(Optional) Sets the size of the EIGRP event log.

(Optional) Enables logging of EIGRP neighbor adjacency changes. By default, the system logs EIGRP neighbor adjacency changes to help you monitor the stability of the routing system and detect problems.
(Optional) Enables the logging of EIGRP neighbor warning messages.
Exits router configuration mode and returns to privileged EXEC mode.
pageTitle: IP Routing: EIGRP Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS XE Release 3SE (Catalyst 3850 Switches) - EIGRP [Cisco Catalyst 3850 Series Switches] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {54331=Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) authentication is configurable on a per-interface basis; packets exchanged between neighbors connected through an interface are authenticated. EIGRP supports message digest algorithm 5 (MD5) authentication to prevent the introduction of unauthorized information from unapproved sources. MD5 authentication is defined in RFC 1321.}

textAfterTable: Configuring the EIGRP Event Logging Named Configuration SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    router eigrp virtual-instance-name 4.   Enter one of the following: address-family ipv4 [multicast] [unicast] [vrf vrf-name] autonomous-system autonomous-system-number address-family ipv6 [unicast] [vrf vrf-name] autonomous-system autonomous-system-number 5.    eigrp log-neighbor-warnings [seconds] 6.    eigrp log-neighbor-changes 7.    topology {base | topology-name tid number} 8.    eigrp event-log-size size
